result.execSummary:
The defendant Jadon L. Henry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jadon L. Henry is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jadon L. Henry was found guilty of Burglary-Armed w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  May not have contact with Joseph D, Kurtis D, Keith S, Clive M, any of the other co-defts, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  (DOC-2156)  Def. has successfully completed the Challenge Incarceration Program, and the court shall modify the bifurcated sentence.  The portion of confinement time not served will be added to extended supervision time.  Total length of sentence will not be changed.  DOC shall determine the number of days converted from confinement to extended supervision based on actual release date.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Johnson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 8 years WSP concurrent to 15CF902:  4 years initial confinement w/credit for 451 days served; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.  No contact w/Joseph D., Kurtis D., Keith S., Clive M. or any of the other co-deft's.
Extradition Costs Determined - $165.89

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Johnson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Johnson acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  On State's motion, cts 1 & 2 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  Court orders extradition costs of $165.89 (by stipulation of deft).  SEH 4/17/17 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.  Atty Johnson withdraws motions previously filed.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Johnson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Johnson states he is not available on the JS date of 12/12/16 and will not be prepared to proceed by that date, has new evidence he needs to evaluate; requests a new trial date.  Deft withdraws his speedy trial demand.  Court grants adjournment of JS from 12/12/16 at 8:30am to 3/6/17 at 8:30am.
With Atty Johnson and ADA Drees the JSH of 11/23/16 at 9am is rescheduled, as Atty Johnson just took over the case from Atty Rufo and is unable to appear; reset to 11/30/16 at 1:45pm.

State's motion to adjourn trial is granted, to allow time to obtain additional phone records and DNA results.  JSH 11/23/16 at 9:00.  JS 12/12/16 at 8:30.  JT 12/13/16 at 9:00.  Defense motion to modify bond to a signature bond is denied by the Court.  Bond continued.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Rufo.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rufo's motion to modify bond.  Court denies motion for reasons set forth on the record.
for a Bond Modification, filed by Atty Andrea Rufo.  (Hearing 9/1/16 at 8:15.)

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Rufo.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rufo requests to adjourn trial as she was out ill and was unable to prepare for trial.  Court finds good cause to not proceed today and grants adjournment, JS reset to 10/10/16 at 8:30am.  Atty Rufo request to modify bond, reinstates speedy trial demand.  Court denies motion to modify bond.  DDA Graveley questions whether or not the deft would submit to a buccal swab otherwise he will prepare an order.  ADA Rufo states the deft does not object to having a swab taken.  Court orders that a buccal swab is to be obtained.
With Atty Rufo and DDA Graveley and by approval of Judge Wagner, the JS of 8/15/16 at 8:30am is changed to a STC.

Atty Graveley requests trial date be moved to 8/15 at 8:30 AM as he has a speedy trial demand that was previously scheduled before this case in Branch 8 on Monday.  Court grants request.  Jury Selection scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
